content.description:
The Classic route at Lac Sylvère, a very wide route in three sections with lots of variations. It's possible to set up a top-rope off of the trees using a 70m rope or 2 ropes tied together. Vilnious to the left would be the easiest way to get to the top of the cliff. The left climber's trail continues right up to the base of Baltique. Standard ice rack with runners.
Spare slings and rap rings may be needed.

This route is fairly wide and varied, pick a line, move around and try something new. At the fork in the trail, take a right up the hill. The trail continues right up to the base of Estonie. From there, follow a trail on the left up a large boulder section. Regular ice rack, no stubbies or rock gear needed.
Bring slings and rap rings.

Very wide route with tons of possibilities. The first section is a very wide double shelf about 20m high. The top of these shelf can also be reached by a trail through the trees on the left to setup a top-rope. The second section is a vertical wall of ice with many choices: On the left, you are faced with a fairly regular section. In the middle, you have a corner which makes the going a little bit easier. On the right is the ever dripping main flow. The route tops off in a gully where a belay/rap can be done off the trees. At the fork in the trail, take a right up the hill. The trail continues right up to the base of the climb. Standard ice rack with runners.
No stubbies or rock gear needed.
Spare slings and rap rings may be needed.

climbs.name: Estonie Right
climbs.fa: 1970's, equipped by Dominic Asselin as a mixed route

content.description:
Rarely formed ice climb originally climbed in the 70's. I has now been equipped with bolts for mixed climbing. Une voie de glace grimpé dans les années 70 qui se forme très rarement. La voie a été équipé avec des scellements pour permettre du mixte. Rocky face on the right of the Estonie Left corner and cedar tree. Face rocheuse à droite du coin de Estonie gauche et de son cèdre. 5 bolts and tree anchor.
5 plaquettes et relais sur arbre.

Thin sections of ice and curtains, no clear lines, but lots of mixed potential. At the fork in the trail with climbing signs, take a left towards Baltique. The trail continues right up to the base of Baltique. From there, follow the cliff 20m to the right and you get two spots to start off from. Thin ice gear, rock pro, pins?
slings and rap rings.

The hardest route at Lac Sylvère, a very nice flow of ice containing two pillars. Some times the pillars don't reach the ground but it can be possible to climb behind them and transfer onto them higher up. At the fork in the trail with climbing signs, take a left towards Baltique. The trail continues right up to the base of Baltique, from there follow the cliff passed the thin ice sections of Lietuva. Standard ice rack with runners.
Spare slings and rap rings may be needed.

A steep climb composed of a few thin curtains. 1. Take a right up the hill towards Estonie. The trail continues right up to the base of Estonie. From there, follow a trail on the left up a large boulder section and keep following the cliff past Eesti. 2. At the fork in the trail with a sign, take a left towards Baltique. The trail continues right up to the base of Baltique, from there follow the cliff passed the thin ice sections of Lietuva and the two pillars of Lituanie. Regular ice rack.
Bring slings and rap rings.

An easy ice gully climb that reaches the top of the cliff. The route can be split up in two pitches that matches the rappelling points. Most of the route could be considered WI2-3 thanks to a steep vertical ending at about WI3. Variations -After the first section, 5m on the right of the gully, a couple vertical pillars at about WI3+. -At the last vertical wall, you can bypass it by following a ledge/runnel on your right, (don't forget your second!) Take the left trail to Baltique, passed the boulder field, take a left before an icy shelf and boulder. Follow a trail on the left passed a short clearing and up the gully. Regular ice rack, slings and runners.
No stubbies or rock gear needed.
Bring rap slings and rap rings.
Some of the more popular climbs are located here and most are in great condition by mid season.
